body.p: To His Excellency the Governor of the State of Kentucky.

The undersigned being citizens residing in Lockport, in the State of Illinois, would Respectfully Represent that they are personally acquainted with John Fleming a convict in the State prison at Frankfort on the charge of Larceny. That Mr Fleming has during the many years of his residence at this place, maintained a good character for honesty and industry.
That said Fleming has a family consisting of a wife and one Daughter who are objects of charity who reside in this village.

Said Fleming was sentenced for four years & has been confined for three years & Eight months during which period he has well conducted himself. We trust your Excellency will believe with us that the Punishment already inflicted is an ample vindication of the Law and the demands of Justice and that in mercy you will Exercise Executive clemency and permit the said Fleming to return to his family & Home.
